page.title: Apple TV A1469 (3rd generation Rev A)

revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix
revision.text:

|ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth1chip = SMSC;LAN8742; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = |oui = |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = |pwr_volt_type = |pwr_vdc = |pwr_amp_dc = |pwr_vac = |pwr_ac_hz = |pwr_amp_ac = |pwr_poe_type = |pwr_poe = |pwr_poe_amp = |pwr_conn = |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = Bluetooth 4.0 LE, DFS, HDMI, |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = abgn |defaulip = |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 01/29/2013 |estreldate = 2013 |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4334; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 2.4 or 5 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Per the FCC WiFi test report, the firmware used in the device during testing was '''Rel_6_10_56_189'''. The '''Broadcom''' WL driver used was 6.10 RC56.189. The FCC Bluetooth test report indicates the device is using BCM4334 (BCM4334B0). "820-3351-04" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. ==Links of Interest== *[https://www.macrumors.com/2013/03/10/tweaked-apple-tv-contains-die-shrunk-a5-chip-not-a5x/ ''Tweaked Apple TV Contains Die-Shrunk A5 Chip, Not A5X'' on '''MacRumors'''] *[https://www.slideshare.net/jjwu6266/apple-ios-device-2013 ''Apple iOS Device 2013'' on '''SlideShare'''] *[http://thenextweb.com/apple/2013/01/30/fcc-filing-teases-new-a5x-powered-smaller-apple-tv-with-iphone-5s-broadcom-wireless-chip/ New, smaller Apple TV 3,2 features A5X processor, iPhone 5′s Broadcom BCM4334 chip - '''The Next Web''']
*[http://www.anandtech.com/show/6709/slightly-smaller-apple-tv-32-a1469-contains-a5x-soc-bcm4334-combo Slightly Smaller Apple TV 3,2 (A1469) Contains A5X SoC, BCM4334 Combo - '''Anandtech'''] [[Category:English Documentation]]
